explanation_about_policies.message: There is an overview of all active policies and errors in the file “policies.json” at about:policies.

explanation_intro.message: By clicking on the button a code will be generated. This code must be stored in a file “policies.json” which must be stored in the distribution directory.

explanation_intro_linux.message: Create a directory called “distribution” in the directory where Firefox is located and place the file “policies.json” there.

explanation_intro_macos.message: Create a “distribution” directory inside the /Contents/Resources/ directory of the Firefox application package and place the file “policies.json” there. To open the application package, right-click on the Firefox application in the Finder and choose “show package contents” from the context menu.

explanation_intro_windows.message: Create a directory called “distribution” where the firefox.exe file is located and place the file “policies.json” there.

list_dialog_no_saved_configurations.message: No configurations have been saved yet.

policy_description_3rdParty.message: Preconfiguration of settings for extensions that use chrome.storage.managed

policy_description_3rdparty_JSON_label.message: JSON (configuration must be surrounded by curly brackets {})

policy_description_AllowedDomainsForApps.message: Define domains allowed to access Google Workspace

policy_description_AppUpdatePin.message: Prevent Firefox from being updated beyond the specified version

policy_description_AppUpdateURL.message: Different server URL for Firefox updates

policy_description_Authentication_AllowN.message: Always allow SPNEGO or NTLM on non FQDNs (fully qualified domain names)
Always allow NTLM on non FQDNs
Always allow SPNEGO on non FQDNs

policy_description_Authentication_AllowP.message: Always allow SPNEGO or NTLM with proxy servers
Always allow NTLM with proxy servers
Always allow NTLM with proxy servers

policy_description_Authentication_Privat.message: Enable integrated authentication in private browsing

policy_description_AutoLaunchProtocolsFr.message: Define a list of external protocols that can be used from listed origins without prompting the user

policy_description_BackgroundAppUpdate.message: Install Firefox updates in the background, when the application is not running

policy_description_BlockAboutAddons.message: Block access to the add-ons manager (about:addons)

policy_description_BlockAboutConfig.message: Block access to the browser configuration (about:config)

policy_description_BlockAboutProfiles.message: Block access to the in-content profile manager (about:profiles)

policy_description_BlockAboutSupport.message: Block access to the troubleshooting information page (about:support)

policy_description_CaptivePortal.message: Enable or disable captive portal support

policy_description_Certificates_ImportEn.message: read certificates from the system certificate store (Windows and macOS only)
don't read certificates from the system certificate store
read certificates from the system certificate store

policy_description_Certificates_Install.message: Import certificates (Windows: %USERNAME\AppData\Local\Mozilla\Certificates or %USERNAME\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Certificates, macOS: /Library/Application Support/Mozilla/Certificates or ~/Library/Application Support/Mozilla/Certificates, Linux: /usr/lib/mozilla/certificates, /usr/lib64/mozilla/certificates or ~/.mozilla/certificates)

policy_description_Cookies.message: Allow or deny websites to set cookies

policy_description_Cookies_Allow.message: Domains where cookies are always allowed

policy_description_Cookies_AllowSession.message: Domains where cookies are only allowed for the current session

policy_description_Cookies_Behavior_limi.message: Reject third party cookies for sites you haven’t visited

policy_description_Cookies_Behavior_reje.message: Reject cookies for known trackers and partition third-party cookies

policy_description_Cookies_BehaviorPriva.message: Default behavior for cookies in private windows
Reject cookies for known trackers and partition third-party cookies (Default)

policy_description_Cookies_Block.message: Domains where cookies are always blocked

policy_description_DefaultDownloadDirect.message: You can use ${home} for the native home directory

policy_description_DisabledCiphers.message: Enable or disable specific cryptographic ciphers

policy_description_DisableFeedbackComman.message: Disable the menu items “Submit Feedback” and “Report Deceptive Site” in the help menu

policy_description_DisableFirefoxAccount.message: Disable Mozilla account based services like Firefox Sync

policy_description_DisableFirefoxScreens.message: Disable the built-in screenshot tool (Firefox Screenshots)

policy_description_DisableFirefoxStudies.message: Prevent Firefox from installing and running studies and contextual feature recommendations

policy_description_DisableForgetButton.message: Disable the “Forget” toolbar button which can be used to forget the last browsing history

policy_description_DisableFormHistory.message: Disable the form and search bar history

policy_description_DisablePasswordReveal.message: Do not allow passwords to be revealed in saved logins

policy_description_DisablePocket.message: Disable the integration of Pocket, a service by Mozilla

policy_description_DisableProfileImport.message: Disable the “Import data from another browser” menu item in the library

policy_description_DisableProfileRefresh.message: Disable the “Refresh Firefox” button in about:support

policy_description_DisableSafeMode.message: Disable the menu item to restart Firefox with add-ons disabled (safe mode)

policy_description_DisableSecurityBypass.message: Prevent certain security warnings from being bypassed
Prevent adding an exception when an invalid certificate is shown
Prevent the warning from being bypassed and a malicious website from being visited

policy_description_DisableSetDesktopBack.message: Disable the feature to set an image as desktop background

policy_description_DisableSystemAddonUpd.message: Prevent Firefox from installing and updating system add-ons

policy_description_DisableTelemetry.message: Prevent Firefox from sending technical and interaction data to Mozilla (telemetry)

policy_description_DisplayBookmarksToolb.message: Show the bookmarks toolbar by default

policy_description_DisplayMenuBar_always.message: The menubar is always shown and cannot be hidden

policy_description_DisplayMenuBar_defaul.message: The menubar is off by default but can be shown
The menubar is on by default but can be hidden

policy_description_DisplayMenuBar_never.message: The menubar is hidden and cannot be shown

policy_description_DNSOverHTTPS_Excluded.message: Exclude domains from DNS over HTTPS

policy_description_DontCheckDefaultBrows.message: Configure check for default browser on startup
Check on startup if Firefox is the default browser
Don't check on startup if Firefox is the default browser

policy_description_DownloadDirectory.message: Set and lock the download directory

policy_description_DownloadDirectory_Lab.message: You can use ${home} for the native home directory

policy_description_EncryptedMediaExtensi.message: Enable or disable Encrypted Media Extensions (needed for video streaming portals)
If disabled, Firefox will not download the Widevine CDM unless the user consents to installing it. If disabled and locked the user will not be asked to download Widevine.

policy_description_ExemptDomainFileTypeP.message: Disable download warnings based on file extensions and domains

policy_description_Extensions_Deprecated.message: Deprecated. The following policy should be used.

policy_description_Extensions_Install.message: Install add-ons. You can specify URLs or paths.

policy_description_Extensions_Locked.message: Locked extensions cannot be disabled or uninstalled. Please specify extension IDs.

policy_description_Extensions_Uninstall.message: Uninstall add-ons. Please specify extension IDs.

policy_description_ExtensionSettings.message: Manage the installation and uninstallation of add-ons

policy_description_ExtensionSettings_blo.message: Error message to display to the user when trying to install an blocked add-on
Error message to display to the user when trying to install the blocked add-on

policy_description_ExtensionSettings_ins.message: Allowed installation sources. Both the location of the *.xpi file and the page where the download is started from must be allowed. Match patterns allowed, see info link.
install URL. If installing from the local file system, use a file:/// URI.
the installation of add-ons by the user is allowed
the installation of this add-on by the user is allowed
the installation of add-ons by the user is not allowed and already installed add-ons will be removed from the device
the installation of this add-on by the user is not allowed and the add-on will be removed from the device if already installed
the add-on is automatically installed and can't be removed by the user (requires an install url)
the add-on is automatically installed but can be disabled by the user (requires an install url)

policy_description_ExtensionSettings_res.message: Domains on which content scripts can't be run

policy_description_ExtensionSettings_tem.message: Allow installation of extensions with a weak signature algorithm (Firefox 127+)

policy_description_ExtensionUpdate.message: Enable or disable automatic extension updates

policy_description_GoToIntranetSiteForSi.message: Force direct intranet site navigation instead of searching when typing single word entries in the address bar

policy_description_Handlers_property_ask.message: Ask the user what they want to do with the file
The action is taken without user intervention
The user is asked what they want to do with the file

policy_description_Handlers_property_han.message: A list of handlers, where the first handler is the default handler. If there is to be no standard handler, an empty object is to be used for the first handler. Either the path to a local application or the URL to a web-based handler can be specified.
The display name of the handler (might not be used)
URL to a web-based handler. Must start with https:// and contain “%s“ for the substitution

policy_description_Homepage_StartPage_Ho.message: … the website defined as homepage (but the user can also optionally start with the previous browser session)
… the website defined as homepage (the user cannot start with the previous browser session)

policy_description_LegacySameSiteCookieB.message: Enable the legacy default behaviour for SameSite cookies
Enable the legacy behavior for SameSite cookies on specified websites

policy_description_LocalFileLinks.message: Allow specific websites to link to local files

policy_description_ManagedBookmarks.message: Managed bookmarks (cannot be changed or removed by the user)

policy_description_ManualAppUpdateOnly.message: Do not prompt for Firefox updates

policy_description_NetworkPrediction.message: Enable or disable network prediction (DNS prefetching)

policy_description_NewTabPage.message: Enable or disable the page that appears when opening a new tab

policy_description_NoDefaultBookmarks.message: Don't create the default bookmarks bundled with Firefox, including the smart bookmarks (most visited, recent tags). Note: this policy is only effective if used before the first run of the profile

policy_description_OfferToSaveLogins.message: Allow Firefox to offer to remember logins and passwords (cannot be overwritten)

policy_description_OfferToSaveLoginsDefa.message: Allow Firefox to offer to remember logins and passwords (can be overwritten by the user)

policy_description_OverrideFirstRunPage.message: Override the first run page. Set this policy to blank if you want to disable the first run page.

policy_description_OverridePostUpdatePag.message: Override the post-update “What's New” page. Set this policy to blank if you want to disable the post-update page.

policy_description_PasswordManagerEnable.message: Enable or disable the password manager completely

policy_description_PasswordManagerExcept.message: Prevent Firefox from saving passwords for specific sites

policy_description_PDFjs.message: Disable or configure the built-in PDF viewer

policy_description_PDFjs_Enabled.message: Enable or disable the built-in PDF viewer

policy_description_PDFjs_EnablePermissio.message: Honor document permissions like preventing the copying of text

policy_description_Permissions_Camera_Bl.message: Block new requests asking to access your camera

policy_description_Permissions_Location_.message: Block new requests asking to access your location

policy_description_Permissions_Microphon.message: Block new requests asking to access your microphone

policy_description_Permissions_Notificat.message: Block new requests asking to allow notifications

policy_description_Permissions_VirtualRe.message: Block new requests asking to access your virtual reality devices

policy_description_PictureInPicture.message: Enable or disable the picture in picture feature for videos

policy_description_PopupBlocking_Allow.message: Domains for which pop-up windows are allowed

policy_description_PopupBlocking_Default.message: pop-ups are not blocked by default

policy_description_Preference_browser_ca.message: Enable / disable storing cache on the hard drive
Change the location of the disk cache

policy_description_Preference_browser_fi.message: Send single words in address bar to DNS first and not directly to search engine

policy_description_Preference_browser_ta.message: Show warning when the browser is closed

policy_description_Preference_browser_ur.message: Suggest bookmarks when using the address bar
Suggest browsing history when using the address bar
Suggest open tabs when using the address bar

policy_description_Preference_datareport.message: Show the privacy policy tab on first run

policy_description_Preference_dom_disabl.message: Allow websites to monkey with window focus
Allow websites to move and resize windows

policy_description_Preference_dom_event_.message: Allow website to override the context menu

policy_description_Preference_dom_keyboa.message: Web standards: Restore old behavior regarding keypress event and non-printable keys for certain domains
Web standards: Restore old behavior regarding keyCode and charCode for certain domains

policy_description_Preference_extensions.message: Show recommendations tab in add-ons manager

policy_description_Preference_media_gmp_.message: Download OpenH264 plugin for WebRTC communication

policy_description_Preference_network_ID.message: Display the punycode version of internationalized domain names

policy_description_Preference_privacy_fi.message: Allow local files to access other local files (security issue!)

policy_description_Preference_security_d.message: Prompt the user to choose the default personal certificate

policy_description_Preference_security_s.message: Allow TLS errors to be sent to Mozilla

policy_description_Preference_ui_key_men.message: The Alt key can be used to show the menu bar

policy_description_Preferences_Status_cl.message: Preference will be reset to default at every start, value has no effect

policy_description_Preferences_Status_de.message: Preference can be changed and appears as default in case of non-default value

policy_description_Preferences_Status_lo.message: Preference can not be changed and appears as default in case of non-default value

policy_description_Preferences_Status_us.message: Preference can be changed and appears as modified in case of non-default value

policy_description_PrimaryPassword.message: Require or prevent using a primary password (formerly known as  master password)

policy_description_PromptForDownloadLoca.message: Ask where to save each file before downloading

policy_description_Proxy.message: Configure proxy access to the internet

policy_description_Proxy_FTPProxy.message: FTP Proxy. To configure port numbers please add a “:” followed by the port number

policy_description_Proxy_HTTPProxy.message: HTTP Proxy. To configure port numbers please add a “:” followed by the port number

policy_description_Proxy_Mode_autoDetect.message: auto-detect proxy settings for this network

policy_description_Proxy_SOCKSProxy.message: SOCKS Host. To configure port numbers please add a “:” followed by the port number

policy_description_Proxy_SSLProxy.message: SSL Proxy. To configure port numbers please add a “:” followed by the port number

policy_description_Proxy_UseHTTPProxyFor.message: don't use this proxy server  for all protocols
use this proxy server  for all protocols

policy_description_Proxy_UseProxyForDNS.message: Proxy DNS when using SOCKS v5

policy_description_RequestedLocales_Requ.message: The corresponding language package must be installed. Leave empty to use the language of the operating system.

policy_description_SanitizeOnShutdown_Lo.message: Protect only the set options from changes

policy_description_SearchBar.message: Whether the search bar is unified or separate

policy_description_SearchBar_options_sep.message: there is a separate search bar

policy_description_SearchBar_options_uni.message: the search and the address bar are unified

policy_description_SearchEngines.message: Modifies the list of search engines built into Firefox

policy_description_SearchEngines_Add_Ali.message: Alias that can be used to access the engine

policy_description_SearchEngines_Add_Pos.message: POST Data (if POST method was selected; e.g. q={searchTerms}&anotherParam=yes)

policy_description_SearchEngines_Add_Sug.message: URL for suggestions. Please use {searchTerms} as placeholder for the search term

policy_description_SearchEngines_Add_URL.message: URL for searches. Please use {searchTerms} as placeholder for the search term

policy_description_SearchEngines_Default.message: Name of the default search engine

policy_description_SearchEngines_Prevent.message: Prevent the installation of new search engines

policy_description_ShowHomeButton.message: Show the home button on the toolbar

policy_description_StartDownloadsInTempD.message: Force downloads to start off in a temporary location rather than the default download directory

policy_description_SupportMenu.message: Add a custom support menu item to the help menu

policy_description_UserMessaging.message: Allow or prevent Firefox from messaging the user

policy_description_UserMessaging_Extensi.message: Recommend extensions while the user is visiting websites

policy_description_UserMessaging_MoreFro.message: Show “More from Mozilla” section in the settings

policy_description_UserMessaging_SkipOnb.message: Disable onboarding screen for new users

policy_description_UserMessaging_UrlbarI.message: Show Firefox specific suggestions in the URL bar

policy_description_UserMessaging_WhatsNe.message: Show the “What's New“ icon and menu item

policy_description_UseSystemPrintDialog.message: Use the system print dialog instead of the print preview window

policy_description_WebsiteFilter.message: Blocks websites from being visited. You can use “<all_urls>” for blocking all URLs. See info link for all valid entries, but only HTTPS and HTTP are supported.

policy_description_WindowsSSO.message: Allow Windows single sign-on for Microsoft, work, and school accounts

requirement_windows_or_linux.message: works only on Windows and Linux
